questionBody: Who is responsible for monitoring and documenting a patient's involvement in an engagement program offered by your pharmaceutical company?
The activities a Patient Connect Support Coordinator performs for a patient are organized within a Patient Connect concept called a  ________
Which of the following is NOT an activity of a Support Coordinator?
option_a: Enroll a patient in an engagement program
option_b: Send patients reminders of upcoming appointments.
option_c: Document adverse events and failures to adhere to the program regimen

questionBody: Which of the following is defined as an undesirable side effect of a drug?
Which of the following examples can be considered as an Adverse Event?
hint: Adverse Event is defined as an undesirable side effect of a drug
option_a: After the medication administration, the patient experienced an injection site irritation
option_b: The needle used for injecting drug failed to fully eject from the device

questionBody: A drug manufacturer's programs into which patients are enrolled into, is called as ________
Which of the following is not a Health Care Professional?
Which of the following is a valid Account type in Patient Connect?
hint: A Participant revolving around Patient's journey of care(including the Patient itself) can be created as an Account Type

questionBody: Both patient or the patient's HCP may fax an enrollment form or submit an online enrollment form to initiate the patient's enrollment?
Typically, a new patient's involvement in a program begins with a submitted enrollment form
As a Support Coordinator I would create a case of Type BI/BV for the patient if I want to _______
hint: BI/ BV = Benefits Investigation/ Benefits Verification

questionBody: The Patientï¿½s consent to participate in the medication program should be received during enrollment and kept up-to-date.
Use when compassionate funding has been authorized to pay for the patient's participation in the engagement program.
Manage an _____________ to the patient's insurance company after it has denied coverage for the patient's participation in the engagement program.
This type of coverage is used to Manage the patient's copay obligations.
A _____________ is required for the patient's insurer to cover the cost of the engagement program.
A medical facility such as a hospital, clinic, or long-term care facility is called as _____________
The patient's insurer is also known as __________
A visiting nurse who educates the patient about the therapy is called as Field Training Nurse.
Which of the following is/ are channels for Patient Enrollment?
A health plan is a set of coverages provided by an insurer (payer)
Branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of cancer is _______
The study of rheumatism, arthritis, and other disorders of the joints, muscles, and ligaments falls under ______
Injection Training is one of the services provided by Pharmaceutical which enables the participants/ patients to -
option_a: Understand the problem of unsafe injection practices and their proposed solutions.
option_b: Providing hands on experience to the participants/ patients

questionBody: If the mode of drug intake is Oral Tablet, then do you still need Injection Training as a service for that drug?
Patient Consent is mandatory to record in order to enroll a Patient and/ or reach out to the Patient via a preferred channel?
Which of the following is categorized as a Chronic Disease?
Can any Pharmacy be a Speciality Pharmacy?
Specialty pharmacy services may include which of the following ?
option_c: Dispensing and Delivery of specialty medications

questionBody: A co-pay is the fixed amount that insurance companies ask consumers to pay toward their medication or other health services.
Your expenses for medical care that aren't reimbursed by insurance is called as
Out-of-pocket costs include
A medical reimbursement specialist's role includes -
option_a: Working with insurance and billing companies to determine the method of payment for patients.
option_b: Administrative duties, such as managing financial and medical records
option_c: Greet new patients and schedule appointments

questionBody: The National Health Service (NHS) in the UK is _________
option_c: Can be categorized as either A or B

questionBody: A _________ is the amount you pay for health care services before your health insurance begins to pay.
A ____________ is your share of the costs of a health care service. It's usually figured as a percentage of the amount we allow to be charged for services.
A _____________ is a fixed amount you pay for a health care service, usually when you receive the service. The amount can vary by the type of service.
Before you can request an appeal, something must be denied, a service, payment or coverage.
In case of a Coverage denial, A letter of support from your __________  indicating the medical reasons that the requested service should be approved.
It is possible to appeal for only a part of the coverage denial.
You can request an urgent or expedited coverage appeal if you:
option_a: Are currently receiving or you were prescribed to receive treatment
option_b: Your medical provider believes a delay in treatment could seriously jeopardize your life or overall health

questionBody: Patient Connect feature enabling patient engagement through a _____________ where patients can input adherence information and receive appointment and medication reminders.
Patient Connect feature where enabling HCP engaging through the _____________ where providers can view information on the status of their patientsï¿½ coverage and adherence

Patient Connect feature enabling patient engagement through a ____________ where patients can view their treatment status, clinical information, appointments, and communicate with their provider or Support Coordincator
__________ is an entity other than the patient that finances or reimburse the cost of health services.
Coverage can be of type:
The science and activities relating to the detection, assessment, understanding and prevention of adverse effects or any other drug-related problem is defined as _____
GDPR regulation enforces which of the following rights to healthcare consumers?
option_a: Right for data subjects to obtain from the data controller confirmation as to whether or not personal data concerning them is being processed, where and for what purpose
option_b: Right for data subjects to have the data controller erase his/her personal data, cease further dissemination of the data, and potentially have third parties halt processing of the data.
option_c: Right for a data subject to receive the personal data concerning them, which they have previously provided in a 'commonly use and machine readable format' and have the right to transmit that data to another controller

questionBody: The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) sets the standard for sensitive patient data protection.
HIPAA Compliance is not mandatory for companies that deal with protected health information (PHI).
If the total cost of doctor's office visit was $104, and your medical plan includes $25 doctor copay visits, how much of the cost would be paid You; Insurance Company?
If a patient enrollment form has missing patient consent/ signature, we can still begin treatment for them?
A premium is :
A deductible is :
A copay is :
option_c: A flat fee for a covered service

questionBody: An out-of-pocket maximum is :
option_a: the most you have to pay each year toward your medical services or prescription drugs
option_b: A limit on your doctor charges
option_c: The most your insurane will pay

questionBody: Your insurer may not cover certain tests or procedures unless you first get:
___________ feature in Patient Connect indicates where the patient is along the program journey.
__________ feature in Patient Connect contains Log of all historical and upcoming activities. These activities drive the activity list seen on the Support Coordinator home screen.
__________ feature in Patient Connect lists out all sub-cases that capture workflows for the patient, such as Benefits Investigations and Prior Authorizations.
__________ feature in Patient Connect quickly highlights to the Support Coordinator what needs attention for the patient.
__________ lets the Support Coordinator quickly initiate workflows while never having to leave the program case page
This case is used as the master construct, and other data pertaining to the patient is linked to this case.
This object in Patient Connect serves as an inbox/outbox feature for communications sent to and from Patient Connect, includes emails, faxes, and online submitted forms.
Homepage in Patient Connect serves as a one stop shop for Support Coordinators to know about:
option_c: High-level metrics for the patient population they manage

questionBody: A Patient is in pretreatment, and has a completed BI/BV that indicates a PA is required. What is the next step for Support Coordinator to do in Patient Connect?
option_a: Goes to the Action Center and begins the prior authorization workflow
option_b: Goes to the Action Center and select ï¿½Find Pharmacy Plan Detailsï¿½
option_c: Goes to the Action Center and selects ï¿½Book Appointmentï¿½

questionBody: A complete Patient enrollment form has been received. What is the next step for Support Coordinator to do in Patient Connect?
option_b: Sends back the form to request patient for Missing Information
option_c: Sends back the form to request patient for Missing Signature

questionBody: An enrollment form has been received, but upon opening, Support Coordinator realizes it is missing information. What is the next step for Support Coordinator to do in Patient Connect?
option_b: Indicate missing pieces of information and sends back the form to user/ patient.
option_c: Goes to the Action Center and begins the prior authorization workflow

questionBody: Support Coordinator notices a new alert on its homepage for indicating a patient is at an adherence risk and is due for a field team member to make a house call. What is the next step for Support Coordinator to do in Patient Connect?
option_a: Schedule the house visit via Action Center> ï¿½Book Appointmentï¿½ feature, and the field team member can access Patient Connect via the Salesforce1 Platform

questionBody: Which of the following best describes features of Patient Portal in Patient Connect?
option_a: Shows real-time data for a patient on a specific program
option_b: Patient Journey Timeline with open activity ï¿½ empowers patient to know where they are in the journey

questionBody: Which of the following best describes features of HCP Portal in Patient Connect?
option_a: High level summary graphics that can help provider(HCP) manage their patient's data

questionBody: Which of the following best describes current features of Patient Mobile Application in Patient Connect?
option_a: Patient can input daily medication dosages
option_b: Patient can set reminders for medication
option_c: Patient can track their symptoms and activities
